articles.title: Vocabulario de Comida Checa para Parejas
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Vocabulario de Comida Checa para Parejas

La cocina checa es abundante, reconfortante y perfecta para compartir. Conocer el vocabulario culinario te ayudar√° a disfrutar las comidas con tu pareja y tal vez cocinar juntos.

## Vocabulario B√°sico

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Dobrou chu≈•!"
  translation="¬°Buen provecho!"
  pronunciation="DOB-ro jut"
  context="Se dice antes de empezar a comer. Es importante y esperado."
/>

| Checo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **j√≠dlo** | YIID-lo | comida |
| **sn√≠danƒõ** | SNII-da-nye | desayuno |
| **obƒõd** | O-byed | almuerzo |
| **veƒçe≈ôe** | VE-che-rzhe | cena |
| **p≈ôedkrm** | PRZHED-krm | entrante |

<VocabCard
  word="Co m√°me k veƒçe≈ôi?"
  translation="¬øQu√© hay para cenar?"
  pronunciation="tso MAA-me k VE-che-rzhi"
  example="Pregunta cotidiana en casa"
/>

## Platos Tradicionales

### La Estrella: Sv√≠ƒçkov√°

<VocabCard
  word="Sv√≠ƒçkov√° na smetanƒõ"
  translation="Solomillo en salsa de crema"
  pronunciation="SVIICH-ko-vaa na SME-ta-nye"
  example="El plato nacional checo por excelencia"
/>

<CultureTip title="Sv√≠ƒçkov√°" flag="üá®üáø">
La sv√≠ƒçkov√° es EL plato checo. Carne tierna en salsa de crema con ar√°ndanos, nata y knedl√≠ky. Si la babiƒçka (abuela) de tu pareja la prepara, prep√°rate para una experiencia culinaria especial.
</CultureTip>

### Knedl√≠ky (Dumplings)

<VocabCard
  word="Knedl√≠ky"
  translation="Dumplings checos"
  pronunciation="KNED-lii-ki"
  example="Acompa√±amiento imprescindible"
/>

| Tipo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Descripci√≥n |
|------|---------------|-------------|
| **houskov√©** | HOUS-ko-ve | de pan |
| **bramborov√©** | BRAM-bo-ro-ve | de papa |
| **ovocn√©** | O-vots-ne | de frutas |

### Otros Platos Principales

| Checo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **vep≈ôo-knedlo-zelo** | VEP-rzho-KNED-lo-ZE-lo | Cerdo, knedl√≠ky y col |
| **sma≈æen√Ω s√Ωr** | SMA-zhe-nii SIIR | Queso frito |
| **≈ô√≠zek** | RZHII-zek | Escalope empanado |
| **gul√°≈°** | GU-laash | Gulash |
| **brambor√°ky** | bram-bo-RAA-ki | Tortitas de papa |

<VocabCard
  word="Sma≈æen√Ω s√Ωr"
  translation="Queso frito"
  pronunciation="SMA-zhe-nii SIIR"
  example="Comida favorita de muchos checos"
/>

## Sopas (Pol√©vky)

<VocabCard
  word="Pol√©vka"
  translation="Sopa"
  pronunciation="PO-lev-ka"
  example="El almuerzo checo siempre incluye sopa"
/>

| Checo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **ƒçesneƒçka** | CHES-nech-ka | Sopa de ajo |
| **bramboraƒçka** | bram-bo-RACH-ka | Sopa de papa |
| **zel≈àaƒçka** | ZEL-nyach-ka | Sopa de col |
| **kulajda** | ku-LAI-da | Sopa de eneldo |

<CultureTip title="Sopa Primero" flag="üá®üáø">
En la comida tradicional checa, la sopa siempre va primero. "Pol√©vka je grunt" (la sopa es fundamental) es un dicho popular. No saltarte la sopa cuando te la ofrezcan.
</CultureTip>

## Pan y Productos Horneados

<VocabCard
  word="Chleba"
  translation="Pan"
  pronunciation="HLEB-a"
  example="El pan checo es oscuro y denso"
/>

| Checo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **rohl√≠k** | ROH-liik | Bollito alargado |
| **kol√°ƒç** | ko-LAACH | Pastel dulce |
| **buchty** | BUCH-ti | Bollos dulces |
| **trdeln√≠k** | TR-del-niik | Pastel enrollado |

<VocabCard
  word="Trdeln√≠k"
  translation="Pastel enrollado tradicional"
  pronunciation="TR-del-niik"
  example="Muy popular en Praga, se come caliente"
/>

## Bebidas

### La Cerveza Checa

<VocabCard
  word="Pivo"
  translation="Cerveza"
  pronunciation="PI-vo"
  example="Rep√∫blica Checa es el pa√≠s con mayor consumo de cerveza per c√°pita"
/>

| Checo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **svƒõtl√©** | SVYET-le | clara |
| **tmav√©** | TMA-ve | oscura |
| **ƒçepovan√©** | che-PO-va-ne | de barril |
| **lahvov√©** | LAH-vo-ve | de botella |

<CultureTip title="Cultura Cervecera" flag="üá®üáø">
La cerveza checa es legendaria. Pilsner Urquell, Budweiser Budvar, Staropramen... Pedir "jedno pivo" (una cerveza) en una hospoda es casi obligatorio. Los checos son muy orgullosos de su cerveza.
</CultureTip>

### Otras Bebidas

| Checo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **voda** | VO-da | agua |
| **v√≠no** | VII-no | vino |
| **k√°va** | KAA-va | caf√© |
| **ƒçaj** | chai | t√© |
| **slivovice** | SLI-vo-vi-tse | aguardiente de ciruela |

<VocabCard
  word="Slivovice"
  translation="Aguardiente de ciruela"
  pronunciation="SLI-vo-vi-tse"
  example="Licor tradicional, ¬°muy fuerte!"
/>

## Postres

<VocabCard
  word="Dezert"
  translation="Postre"
  pronunciation="DE-zert"
  example="Los postres checos son abundantes"
/>

| Checo | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **palaƒçinky** | pa-LA-chin-ki | Crepes |
| **zmrzlina** | ZMRZ-li-na | Helado |
| **≈°tr√∫dl** | SHTRUUDL | Strudel |
| **ovocn√© knedl√≠ky** | O-vots-ne KNED-lii-ki | Knedl√≠ky de frutas |
| **medovn√≠k** | ME-dov-niik | Pastel de miel |

<VocabCard
  word="Ovocn√© knedl√≠ky"
  translation="Knedl√≠ky de frutas"
  pronunciation="O-vots-ne KNED-lii-ki"
  example="Rellenos de fresas, albaricoques o ciruelas"
/>

## Frases √ötiles

<VocabCard
  word="Je to v√Ωborn√©!"
  translation="¬°Est√° excelente!"
  pronunciation="ye to VII-bor-ne"
  example="El mejor cumplido"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="D√°me si je≈°tƒõ jedno"
  translation="Pidamos otra"
  pronunciation="DAA-me si YESH-tye YED-no"
  example="Para pedir otra ronda"
/>

| Frase | Pronunciaci√≥n | Espa√±ol |
|-------|---------------|---------|
| **M√°m hlad** | maam hlad | Tengo hambre |
| **Jsem syt√Ω/√°** | ysem SI-tii/aa | Estoy lleno/a |
| **√öƒçet, pros√≠m** | UU-chet PRO-siim | La cuenta, por favor |
| **Na zdrav√≠!** | na ZDRA-vii | ¬°Salud! |

<VocabCard
  word="Uva≈ôme si spolu"
  translation="Cocinemos juntos"
  pronunciation="U-varzh-me si SPO-lu"
  example="Invitaci√≥n rom√°ntica"
/>

<CultureTip title="Propinas" flag="üá®üáø">
En Rep√∫blica Checa, la propina es del 10% y generalmente se redondea. Al pagar, di la cantidad total que quieres pagar: "Stoƒçty≈ôicet" (ciento cuarenta) si la cuenta es 130 y quieres dejar 10 de propina.
</CultureTip>

<CTA />

articles.title: Angol kifejez√©sek f√©lt√©kenys√©ghez √©s bizalomhoz
articles.content:
A f√©lt√©kenys√©g minden kapcsolatban megjelenhet ‚Äì a fontos, hogy tudd, hogyan besz√©lj r√≥la. Ha angol anyanyelv≈± partnered van, ezek a kifejez√©sek seg√≠tenek konstrukt√≠van kezelni ezeket az √©rz√©seket.

## Mi√©rt fontos err≈ël besz√©lni?

A f√©lt√©kenys√©g elfed√©se vagy tagad√°sa csak rontja a helyzetet. Az ≈ëszinte kommunik√°ci√≥ seg√≠t meg√©rteni egym√°s √©rz√©seit √©s er≈ës√≠teni a bizalmat.

## Kifejez√©sek a f√©lt√©kenys√©g kifejez√©s√©hez

### 1. "I feel jealous when..."
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åj f√≠l dzselesz ven

**Jelent√©s:** F√©lt√©keny vagyok, amikor...

**P√©lda:** "I feel jealous when you spend so much time with your coworker."

Az "I feel" haszn√°lata kev√©sb√© t√°mad√≥, mint a "You make me jealous."

### 2. "I need reassurance"
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åj n√≠d r√≠-e-s√∫rensz

**Jelent√©s:** Megnyugtat√°sra van sz√ºks√©gem

**P√©lda:** "Sometimes I need reassurance that I'm important to you."

### 3. "I trust you, but I'm struggling with my feelings"
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åj traszt j√∫, bat √°jm sztr√°geling vit m√°j f√≠lings

**Jelent√©s:** Megb√≠zom benned, de k√ºzd√∂k az √©rz√©seimmel

**P√©lda:** "I trust you completely, but I'm struggling with my feelings right now."

### 4. "Can we talk about what happened?"
**Kiejt√©s:** Ken vi t√≥k ebaut vat heppend

**Jelent√©s:** Besz√©lhet√ºnk arr√≥l, ami t√∂rt√©nt?

**P√©lda:** "I saw you talking to your ex. Can we talk about what happened?"

### 5. "I don't want to be the jealous type, but..."
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åj dont vont tu b√≠ d√∂ dzselesz t√°jp, bat

**Jelent√©s:** Nem akarok f√©lt√©keny t√≠pus lenni, de...

**P√©lda:** "I don't want to be the jealous type, but I felt uncomfortable at the party."

## Kifejez√©sek a bizalom √©p√≠t√©s√©hez

### 6. "I trust you completely"
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åj traszt j√∫ kompl√≠tli

**Jelent√©s:** Teljesen megb√≠zom benned

**P√©lda:** "I want you to know that I trust you completely."

### 7. "You're the only one for me"
**Kiejt√©s:** J√∫r d√∂ onli van for m√≠

**Jelent√©s:** Te vagy az egyetlen nekem

**P√©lda:** "No matter who I talk to, you're the only one for me."

### 8. "I would never do anything to hurt you"
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åj vud never d√∫ eniting tu h√∂rt j√∫

**Jelent√©s:** Soha nem tenn√©k semmit, ami f√°j neked

**P√©lda:** "Please believe me ‚Äì I would never do anything to hurt you."

### 9. "There's nothing going on between us"
**Kiejt√©s:** Dersz nating going on bitv√≠n asz

**Jelent√©s:** Nincs k√∂zt√ºnk semmi

**P√©lda:** "She's just a friend. There's nothing going on between us."

### 10. "I'm committed to you"
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åjm kemited tu j√∫

**Jelent√©s:** Elk√∂telezett vagyok ir√°ntad

**P√©lda:** "I'm fully committed to you and our relationship."

## Kifejez√©sek a helyzet kezel√©s√©hez

### 11. "Let's be open with each other"
**Kiejt√©s:** Letsz b√≠ √≥pen vit √≠cs ader

**Jelent√©s:** Legy√ºnk ny√≠ltak egym√°ssal

**P√©lda:** "To avoid misunderstandings, let's be open with each other."

### 12. "I don't want jealousy to come between us"
**Kiejt√©s:** √Åj dont vont dzseleszi tu kam bitv√≠n asz

**Jelent√©s:** Nem akarom, hogy a f√©lt√©kenys√©g k√∂z√©nk √°lljon

**P√©lda:** "I love you too much. I don't want jealousy to come between us."

## Hasznos tippek

**Hallgasd meg a partnered:** Ha ≈ë f√©lt√©keny, ne utas√≠tsd el az √©rz√©seit.

**L√©gy √°tl√°that√≥:** Az √°tl√°that√≥s√°g √©p√≠ti a bizalmat.

**Ne v√°daskodj:** Haszn√°lj "I feel" (√∫gy √©rzem) mondatokat a "You always" (te mindig) helyett.

## √ñsszefoglal√°s

A f√©lt√©kenys√©g term√©szetes √©rz√©s, de a kezel√©se fontos. Az ≈ëszinte kommunik√°ci√≥ √©s a k√∂lcs√∂n√∂s tisztelet seg√≠t er≈ës√≠teni a kapcsolatotokat.

articles.title: Rumensk grammatikk for nybegynnere: L√¶r spr√•ket til din kj√¶re p√• en enkel m√•te
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Skal du og din partner l√¶re rumensk sammen? Grammatikk trenger ikke √• v√¶re skremmende! N√•r du forst√•r de grunnleggende reglene, kan du raskt bygge setninger som smelter hjertet til din rumenske kj√¶re. I denne guiden l√¶rer du de viktigste grammatikkreglene gjennom romantiske eksempler dere faktisk vil bruke. [Start med √• l√¶re de viktigste hilsenene](/learn/no/ro/greetings-and-farewells/) f√∏rst!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Te iubesc"
  translation="Jeg elsker deg"
  pronunciation="teh YOO-besk"
  context="Det viktigste du noen gang vil si p√• rumensk."
/>

## Den enkle forklaringen

Rumensk grammatikk ligner faktisk mer p√• norsk enn du tror! Ordstillingen er ganske lik, og verb b√∏yes etter person (jeg, du, han osv.). Tenk p√• det som √• kle p√• ordene - de f√•r forskjellige "antrekk" avhengig av hvem som handler og n√•r det skjer.

<CultureTip flag="üá∑üá¥" title="Kj√¶rlighetsspr√•ket">
Rumensk er et romansk spr√•k, s√• det har mye til felles med italiensk og fransk. Dette gj√∏r det enklere hvis du allerede kjenner til disse spr√•kene!
</CultureTip>

## Grunnreglene du m√• kunne

### 1. Bestemte og ubestemte artikler
- **en** for maskuline ord (en bƒÉiat - en gutt)
- **o** for feminine ord (o fatƒÉ - en jente)
- **un** for n√∏ytrale ord (un copil - et barn)

### 2. Verb b√∏yes etter person
Verb endres avhengig av hvem som utf√∏rer handlingen. Dette er lettere enn det h√∏res ut!

<ConjugationTable
  verb="a iubi"
  meaning="√• elske"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Jeg", polish: "eu iubesc", english: "jeg elsker" },
    { person: "Du", polish: "tu iube»ôti", english: "du elsker" },
    { person: "Han/Hun", polish: "el/ea iube»ôte", english: "han/hun elsker" },
    { person: "Vi", polish: "noi iubim", english: "vi elsker" },
    { person: "Dere", polish: "voi iubi»õi", english: "dere elsker" },
    { person: "De", polish: "ei iubesc", english: "de elsker" }
  ]}
/>

### 3. Kj√∏nn p√• substantiver
Nesten alle substantiver har kj√∏nn, men det finnes enkelte triks:
- Ord som ender p√• **-ƒÉ** er vanligvis feminine (iubire - kj√¶rlighet)
- Ord som ender p√• **consonant** er ofte maskuline (bƒÉiat - gutt)

<VocabCard
  word="iubire"
  translation="kj√¶rlighet"
  pronunciation="yoo-BEE-reh"
  example="Iubirea noastrƒÉ este puternicƒÉ."
/>

## Romantiske eksempler for par

Her er setninger dere faktisk vil bruke med hverandre:

| Rumensk | Norsk | Grammatikk-notat |
|---------|--------|------------------|
| **E»ôti frumoasƒÉ** | Du er vakker | "E»ôti" = du er (informell) |
| **Sunt norocos** | Jeg er heldig | "Sunt" = jeg er |
| **Ne iubim** | Vi elsker hverandre | Refleksivt pronomen "ne" |
| **Pentru tine** | For deg | "tine" = deg (akkusativ) |
| **Cu tine** | Med deg | "cu" = med |

<CultureTip flag="üá∑üá¥" title="Koselige kallenavn">
Rumenskere bruker ofte "iubire" (kj√¶rlighet) og "dragƒÉ" (kj√¶re) som kallenavn. [Les mer om romantiske kallenavn her!](/learn/no/ro/romanian-pet-names-for-your-partner/)
</CultureTip>

## Vanlige verb-m√∏nstre

De mest nyttige verbene for daglige samtaler:

### "A fi" (√• v√¶re)
- eu sunt (jeg er) - "yoh soont"
- tu e»ôti (du er) - "too yesht"
- el/ea este (han/hun er) - "yel/ya yes-teh"

### "A avea" (√• ha)
- eu am (jeg har) - "yoh ahm"
- tu ai (du har) - "tah-ee"
- el/ea are (han/hun har) - "yel/ya ah-reh"

<VocabCard
  word="frumoasƒÉ"
  translation="vakker (feminin)"
  pronunciation="froh-MOH-sah"
  example="E»ôti foarte frumoasƒÉ astƒÉzi."
/>

## √òvings-setninger for par

Pr√∏v disse sammen - de er perfekte for par som l√¶rer:

1. **Ce faci?** (tseh FAH-tchee) - Hva gj√∏r du?
2. **Sunt aici pentru tine** (soont ah-EETCH peh-TRAHN-teh YOO-neh) - Jeg er her for deg
3. **√émi place de tine** (uhm plah-seh deh YOO-neh) - Jeg liker deg
4. **E»ôti specialƒÉ pentru mine** (yesht speh-tsee-AH-lah peh-TRAHN-teh MEE-neh) - Du er spesiell for meg
5. **Vrei sƒÉ √ÆnvƒÉ»õƒÉm √ÆmpreunƒÉ?** (vray sih oon-vuh-TSAHM oom-prah-OO-nah) - Vil du l√¶re sammen?
6. **Limba ta este frumoasƒÉ** (LEEM-bah tah yes-teh froh-MOH-sah) - Ditt spr√•k er vakkert
7. **MƒÉ bucur cƒÉ te am** (mah BOO-koor kah teh ahm) - Jeg er glad for at jeg har deg

## Vanlige feil √• unng√•

**Feil 1:** Blande "tu" og "dumneavoastrƒÉ" (formell "du")
- **Feil:** "Tu iubi»õi?"
- **Riktig:** "Tu iube»ôti?" (Elsker du?)

**Feil 2:** Glemme artikkelen
- **Feil:** "Iubesc fatƒÉ"
- **Riktig:** "Iubesc o fatƒÉ" (Jeg elsker en jente)

**Feil 3:** Feil verbform
- **Feil:** "Eu iube»ôti"
- **Riktig:** "Eu iubesc" (Jeg elsker)

**Feil 4:** Uttale av **ƒÉ**
- Dette er en spesiell rumensk lyd, som "e" i "hver"
- √òv p√•: "dragƒÉ" (kj√¶re) - "DRAH-gah"

## Hurtigreferanse

Lagre dette for enkel tilgang:

| Person | √Ö v√¶re | √Ö ha | √Ö elske |
|--------|--------|------|---------|
| Jeg | sunt | am | iubesc |
| Du | e»ôti | ai | iube»ôti |
| Han/Hun | este | are | iube»ôte |
| Vi | suntem | avem | iubim |
| Dere | sunte»õi | ave»õi | iubi»õi |
| De | sunt | au | iubesc |

## Hva neste steg?

N√• som du forst√•r grunnleggende grammatikk, kan du utforske mer avanserte temaer:
- [Flere romantiske fraser for enhver anledning](/learn/no/ro/romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion/)
- [Ordforr√•d for romantiske stevnem√∏ter](/learn/no/ro/romanian-date-night-vocabulary/)
- [Uttaleguide for nybegynnere](/learn/no/ro/pronunciation-guide-for-beginners/)

Husk: √òv sammen hver dag, feil er en del av l√¶ringsreisen, og din rumenske partner vil elske innsatsen du legger ned!

<CTA />

articles.title: French Love Letter Writing: Romantic Phrases for Your Partner
articles.content:
A love letter in French is perhaps the most romantic gift you can give. French has been the language of love for centuries, and a well-crafted *lettre d'amour* will make your partner's heart soar.

## The French Tradition of Love Letters

French literature is filled with famous love letters. Writing one connects you to a rich romantic tradition. The effort of expressing love in French shows profound devotion.

## Opening Your Letter

### Salutations

**Mon amour**
*My love*

The classic French opening‚Äîtimeless and romantic.

**Mon c≈ìur**
*My heart*

Intimate and tender‚Äîthey are your heart.

**Ma ch√©rie / Mon ch√©ri**
*My darling*

Use *ma ch√©rie* for her, *mon ch√©ri* for him.

**Mon tr√©sor**
*My treasure*

They are precious beyond measure.

## Expressing Your Feelings

### Opening Lines

**Je t'√©cris pour te dire combien je t'aime**
*I'm writing to tell you how much I love you*

Direct and heartfelt opening.

**Les mots me manquent pour exprimer ce que je ressens**
*Words fail me to express what I feel*

Acknowledging that love transcends language.

**J'ai tant de choses √† te dire**
*I have so many things to tell you*

Creating anticipation.

### Declarations of Love

**Tu es la personne la plus importante dans ma vie**
*You are the most important person in my life*

Clear declaration of their significance.

**Chaque jour, je t'aime davantage**
*Every day, I love you more*

Love that continues to grow.

**Tu as transform√© ma vie**
*You have transformed my life*

They changed everything for the better.

**Mon c≈ìur n'appartient qu'√† toi**
*My heart belongs only to you*

Exclusive devotion.

## Romantic Declarations

**Tu es mon rayon de soleil**
*You are my ray of sunshine*

They bring light to your life.

**Sans toi, je ne suis rien**
*Without you, I am nothing*

Dramatic but deeply romantic in French.

**Tu es tout ce dont j'ai toujours r√™v√©**
*You are everything I've always dreamed of*

Dream come true.

## Remembering Special Moments

**Je me souviens de notre premier baiser**
*I remember our first kiss*

Nostalgic reflection.

**Chaque moment pass√© avec toi est grav√© dans mon c≈ìur**
*Every moment spent with you is engraved in my heart*

Memories permanently etched.

**Nos souvenirs sont mes tr√©sors**
*Our memories are my treasures*

Memories valued like precious objects.

## Looking to the Future

**Je veux passer ma vie √† tes c√¥t√©s**
*I want to spend my life by your side*

Commitment to a shared future.

**Je r√™ve d'un avenir ensemble**
*I dream of a future together*

Shared hopes and dreams.

**Je te promets de t'aimer pour toujours**
*I promise to love you forever*

Eternal vow.

## Closing Your Letter

### Sign-Offs

**Avec tout mon amour**
*With all my love*

Classic and sincere.

**√Ä toi pour toujours**
*Yours forever*

Commitment in closing.

**Je t'aime de tout mon c≈ìur**
*I love you with all my heart*

Final declaration.

**Ton/Ta [your name] qui t'aime**
*Your [name] who loves you*

Personal and intimate sign-off.

## Tips for Writing

- **Embrace elegance**: French values refined expression
- **Use sensory details**: French romance engages all senses
- **Be poetic**: French welcomes romantic flourishes
- **Handwrite**: A handwritten French letter is treasured

Your French love letter will become a cherished keepsake, connecting you to the grand tradition of French romantic expression.

articles.title: Rusca Temel Dilbilgisi: T√ºrkler Icin Baslangic Rehberi
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Rusca dilbilgisi T√ºrkce'den √∂nemli farklarla ayrilir, ancak hal sistemi benzerligi avantaj saglar. Bu rehberde Rusca'nin temel dilbilgisi yapisini √∂greneceksiniz.

## Isimler ve Cinsiyet

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–í —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–º —Ç—Ä–∏ —Ä–æ–¥–∞"
  translation="Rusca'da √ºc cinsiyet vardir"
  pronunciation="v rus-kam tri ro-da"
  context="Rusca dilbilgisinin temel kurali"
/>

### Cinsiyet Sistemi

| Cinsiyet | Tipik Son | √ñrnek |
|----------|-----------|-------|
| **Erkek** | √ºns√ºz | –¥–æ–º (ev), —Å—Ç–æ–ª (masa) |
| **Disi** | -–∞, -—è | –º–∞–º–∞ (anne), –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞ (kitap) |
| **N√∂tr** | -–æ, -–µ | –æ–∫–Ω–æ (pencere), –º–æ—Ä–µ (deniz) |

## Hal Sistemi (–ü–∞–¥–µ–∂–∏)

Rusca'da 6 hal vardir:

| Hal | Soru | T√ºrkce Karsiligi |
|----|------|------------------|
| **–ò–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π** | –∫—Ç–æ? —á—Ç–æ? | Yalƒ±n hal |
| **–†–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π** | –∫–æ–≥–æ? —á–µ–≥–æ? | -in, -nin |
| **–î–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π** | –∫–æ–º—É? —á–µ–º—É? | -e, -a |
| **–í–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π** | –∫–æ–≥–æ? —á—Ç–æ? | -i, -yi |
| **–¢–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π** | –∫–µ–º? —á–µ–º? | ile |
| **–ü—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–π** | –æ –∫–æ–º? –æ —á—ë–º? | -de |

<VocabCard
  word="T√ºrkce hal ekleri = Rusca haller"
  translation="Benzer kavram, farkli uygulama"
  pronunciation="Mantik tanidik!"
  example="evde = –≤ –¥–æ–º–µ, eve = –≤ –¥–æ–º"
/>

<CultureTip title="Hal Sistemi Benzerligi" flag="üá∑üá∫">
T√ºrkce'nin hal ekleri (-de, -e, -i, -den) Rusca'nin hal sistemine benzer. Bu, T√ºrkler icin avantajdir!
</CultureTip>

## Fiil Cekimi

<ConjugationTable
  verb="–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å"
  meaning="konusmak"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "—è", word: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—é", translation: "Ben konusurum" },
    { person: "—Ç—ã", word: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—à—å", translation: "Sen konusursun" },
    { person: "–æ–Ω/–æ–Ω–∞", word: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç", translation: "O konusur" },
    { person: "–º—ã", word: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º", translation: "Biz konusuruz" },
    { person: "–≤—ã", word: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ", translation: "Siz konusursunuz" },
    { person: "–æ–Ω–∏", word: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç", translation: "Onlar konusurlar" }
  ]}
/>

### √ñnemli Fiiller

<ConjugationTable
  verb="–±—ã—Ç—å (olmak) - Simdiki zamanda kullanilmaz!"
  meaning="olmak"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "—è", word: "(–µ—Å—Ç—å)", translation: "Ben -im" },
    { person: "—Ç—ã", word: "(–µ—Å—Ç—å)", translation: "Sen -sin" },
    { person: "–æ–Ω/–æ–Ω–∞", word: "(–µ—Å—Ç—å)", translation: "O -dir" },
    { person: "–º—ã", word: "(–µ—Å—Ç—å)", translation: "Biz -iz" },
    { person: "–≤—ã", word: "(–µ—Å—Ç—å)", translation: "Siz -siniz" },
    { person: "–æ–Ω–∏", word: "(–µ—Å—Ç—å)", translation: "Onlar -dir" }
  ]}
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Rusca'da 'olmak' fiili simdiki zamanda d√ºser"
  translation="–Ø —Å—Ç—É–¥–µ–Ω—Ç = Ben √∂grenciyim"
  pronunciation="ya stu-dyent"
  example="'am/is/are' gerekmiyor!"
/>

## Zamirler

| Rusca | T√ºrkce |
|-------|--------|
| —è | ben |
| —Ç—ã | sen |
| –æ–Ω | o (erkek) |
| –æ–Ω–∞ | o (kadin) |
| –æ–Ω–æ | o (n√∂tr) |
| –º—ã | biz |
| –≤—ã | siz |
| –æ–Ω–∏ | onlar |

## Olumsuz C√ºmleler

Olumsuzluk **"–Ω–µ"** ile yapilir:

| Olumlu | Olumsuz |
|--------|---------|
| –Ø –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—é | –Ø **–Ω–µ** –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—é |
| –Ø –ª—é–±–ª—é | –Ø **–Ω–µ** –ª—é–±–ª—é |

## Soru C√ºmleleri

### Soru Kelimeleri

| Rusca | T√ºrkce |
|-------|--------|
| **–ö—Ç–æ?** | Kim? |
| **–ß—Ç–æ?** | Ne? |
| **–ì–¥–µ?** | Nerede? |
| **–ö–æ–≥–¥–∞?** | Ne zaman? |
| **–ü–æ—á–µ–º—É?** | Neden? |
| **–ö–∞–∫?** | Nasil? |

<VocabCard
  word="–ö–∞–∫ —Ç–µ–±—è –∑–æ–≤—É—Ç?"
  translation="Adin ne?"
  pronunciation="kak ti-bya za-vut"
  example="Literal: Sana nasil sesleniyorlar?"
/>

## C√ºmle Yapisi

Rusca c√ºmle sirasi esnektir:

| Dil | Sira |
|-----|------|
| **T√ºrkce** | √ñzne + Nesne + Fiil |
| **Rusca** | Esnek (SVO yaygin) |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é = –¢–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é —è"
  translation="Her ikisi de 'Seni seviyorum' demek"
  pronunciation="ya ti-bya lyub-lyu"
  context="Vurgu icin sira degisebilir"
/>

Rusca dilbilgisi pratikle √∂grenilebilir. Partnerinizle her g√ºn birka√ß c√ºmle kurun!

## √ñƒürenmeye Devam Et

- **[Rus√ßa Telaffuz](/learn/tr/ru/russian-pronunciation-guide/)** - Sesleri √∂ƒürenin
- **[Temel Rus√ßa ƒ∞fadeler](/learn/tr/ru/russian-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Pratik ileti≈üim
- **[Rus√ßa Zor mu?](/learn/tr/ru/is-russian-hard-to-learn/)** - D√ºr√ºst analiz
- **[Rus√ßa Selamla≈ümalar](/learn/tr/ru/russian-greetings-farewells/)** - Temel konu≈üma

<CTA text="Rusca dilbilgisini pratikte √∂ƒürenmek ister misiniz?" buttonText="Hemen Ba≈ülayƒ±n" />
